name: Parental Attachment (Mothers)
author: Lisa DeBruine
description: Items starting with r, p and e are for the rejection (r), overprotection (p), and emotional warmth (e) subscales. Arrindell et al. (1999). The development of a short form of the EMBU: Its appraisal with students in Greece, Guatemala, Hungary and Italy. Personality and Individual Differences, 27, 613-628.

variableMeasured.name: id
variableMeasured.description: A unique ID for each questionnaire completion

variableMeasured.name: r1
variableMeasured.description: It happened that my mother was sour or angry with me without letting me know the cause

variableMeasured.name: e1
variableMeasured.description: My mother praised me

variableMeasured.name: p1
variableMeasured.description: It happened that I wished my mother would worry less about what I was doing

variableMeasured.name: r2
variableMeasured.description: It happened that my mother gave me more corporal punishment than I deserved

variableMeasured.name: p2
variableMeasured.description: When I came home, I then had to account for what I had been doing, to my mother

variableMeasured.name: e2
variableMeasured.description: I think that my mother tried to make my adolescence stimulating, interesting and instructive (for instance by giving me good books, arranging for me to go on camps, taking me to clubs)

variableMeasured.name: r3
variableMeasured.description: My mother criticized me and told me how lazy and useless I was in front of others

variableMeasured.name: p3
variableMeasured.description: It happened that my mother forbade me to do things other children were allowed to do because she was afraid that something might happen to me

variableMeasured.name: no_subscale
variableMeasured.description: My mother tried to spur me to become the best

variableMeasured.name: p4
variableMeasured.description: My mother would look sad or in some other way show that I had behaved badly so that I got real feelings of guilt

variableMeasured.name: p5
variableMeasured.description: I think that my mother's anxiety that something might happen to me was exaggerated

variableMeasured.name: e3
variableMeasured.description: If things went badly for me, I then felt that my mother tried to comfort and encourage me

variableMeasured.name: r4
variableMeasured.description: I was treated as the ‘black sheep' or ‘scapegoat' of the family

variableMeasured.name: e4
variableMeasured.description: My mother showed with words and gestures that he liked me

variableMeasured.name: r5
variableMeasured.description: I felt that my mother liked my brother(s) and/or sister(s) more than she liked me

variableMeasured.name: r6
variableMeasured.description: My mother treated me in such a way that I felt ashamed

variableMeasured.name: p6
variableMeasured.description: I was allowed to go where I liked without my mother caring too much

variableMeasured.name: p7
variableMeasured.description: I felt that my mother interfered with everything I did

variableMeasured.name: e5
variableMeasured.description: I felt that warmth and tenderness existed between me and my mother

variableMeasured.name: p8
variableMeasured.description: My mother put decisive limits for what I was and was not allowed to do, to which she then adhered rigorously

variableMeasured.name: r7
variableMeasured.description: My mother would punish me hard, even for triffles (small offenses)

variableMeasured.name: p9
variableMeasured.description: My mother wanted to decide how I should be dressed or how I should look

variableMeasured.name: e6
variableMeasured.description: I felt that my mother was proud when I succeeded in something I had undertaken
